title: Will the Washington Football Team (fka Washington Redskins) win five or more regular season games in the 2020 NFL season?
preds: With their win over the Steelers, WFT has secured five wins.
Washington has secured their fifth win of the regular season.
They beat the stealers and are now 5-7.

The Washington Football team currently has four wins.  They are tied with Pittsburgh and inching closer to the fifth win.  Pittsburgh is 11-0 this season, so this performance by Washington indicates that a fifth win is high likely.

The current base rate is a 33% win percentage.  With 4 games remaining they should statistically win 1.3 of them putting them at or above 5 wins.  1 of their remaining games (the eagles) has a team that has a worse record than them.  They currently have an expected win ttl of 5.4 given their current point spread but are the underdog in 4 of the 5 remaining games, though only .5 pts vs carolina. https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/was/2020/gamelog/
https://www.thelines.com/odds/washington-football-team/
No change, and likely no change this coming week unless WFT somehow pulls off a miracle win against the Steelers.

Given the momentum of unexpected wins (and by a margin) along with the weak remaining scheduled opponents, my forecast has changed significantly. I expect the WFT to defeat at least 2/5 remaining opponents (Eagles/Panthers).
Adjusting forecast to account for last wins

Washington currently has 4 wins and there are 5 games remaining.  To achieve one more win, Washington needs to win 20% of their remaining games.  Washington's current win percentage is 36.4%.  The probability of losing is 1 - .364 = .636.  The probability of losing all five games is (.636)^5 = 10.4%.  Thus, Washington has a 89.6% chance of winning at least one game and ending the regular season with 5 or more wins.  Additionally, 2 of the 5 teams that Washington will be playing have lower winning percentages than Washington.
As bad as they are, the Eagles are a likely win for them.

Update from original forecast on 11 NOV: from 55% to 95% YES. Currently 4-7 record with five games left with high probability of gaining their fifth win given the remaining opponents on their calendar.

Updating forecast based on recent wins over the Bengals and Cowboys.  Of the 5 remaining games for the 4-7 Washington Football Team, only 1 is a very likely loss (Steelers).  The games against the 49ers, Seahawks, Eagles, and Panthers are all possible wins.  Perhaps the most pressing reason for updating this forecast is the fact that WAS in now in a good position to win the terrible NFC East (translation:  They will be very motivated at the end of a long season when the last place teams like the 9ers and Panthers are cashing in their chips).  I now think it is highly likely that they will win a 5th game.

The decimation of the Cowboys on Thanksgiving opened eyes that the Washington defense is above average and, as long as the offense doesn't lose them games (and with veteran Alex Smith, he is proving lately not to lose them games), they will be competitive.
Their upcoming schedule is gruesome on paper, but their next game is against Pittsburgh, who despite being undefeated, will have an unconventional week due to their delay in the Ravens game. The following week they play at San Francisco, which has been moved to Arizona due to COVID restrictions in Santa Clara county, effectively making it a neutral field game against two comparable teams record-wise. They host the Seahawks, which will most likely be a tough opponent. The last two games of the season include hosting Carolina and at Philadelphia. As long as they stay in contention for the division title, they will have motivation to play and play well. It is looking more and more possible that 5 wins is very attainable for the WFT and so I am drastically increasing my forecast based on their recent play.

Initial forecast assumed WFT was unlikely win an additional 3 games based on their 2-8 record and 8 games remaining. Now at 4-7 (5 games remaining, including 2 against teams with worse records) it seems much more likely that they will gain another victory.

Won last two games.  Should have been successful already if not for the poor play with the lions.  The next 3 games are most likely losses but the game against the Panthers should be a win.  If not, there will be another opportunity with the Eagles the week after.  Either way, chances are pretty good to get the 5th win.

I’m expecting 3 losses in a row (Pittsburgh, SF, Seattle) followed by two decent chances at a win (Carolina and Philly). I’m still below the crowd on this one, as I see about a 1 in 4 chance of WFT losing all 5 remaining games.
Updating the forecast.  As the team currently sits at 4 wins, they only need 1 more win.  Even if it's luck alone, with 5 games remaining, I think they'll squeak out another win.

Washington only needs to win one of the remaining 5 games to reach at least 5 regular season wins.  That is unlikely to occur against the 10-0 Steelers.  The most likely wins would be in the last two games of the season, against the 4-8 Panthers or the 3-6 Eagles that Washington already beat 27-17 in the first game of the year.  While it is likely that Washington wins at least one of the remaining 5 games, the fact that the two weakest opponents are last on the schedule will mean that Washington's morale will be at a low point in the season with little on the line.  For that reason, there is only a moderately high probability this occurs.

Hard to imagine the Washington Football team will fix this target already in week 13 (against Pittsburgh Steelers, 10 - 0 at the time of writing), so the question is likely to remain undecided and open until mid-December at least. Chances of winning one out of four are fairly high, considering soft factors such as momentum in team sports.
SF49ers (home game, week 14, 13 Dec 2020) looks like a team they are ready to beat.

Washington pulled out a convincing win over the Bengals this past Sunday to move their season total to 3 wins (albeit one in which Cincy QB Joe Burrow tore his knee). They need to pull out 2 more victories out of their remaining 6 games to reach a total of 5.
This upcoming week, they face Dallas on Thanksgiving, a game where the Cowboys traditionally show up and play decent. The Cowboys are coming off a big win at Minnesota as well as a strong showing the week before against the undefeated Steelers. I still project that the WFT will lose this game, meaning they will need 2 in their last 5. Washington's next three opponents are at Pitt, at San Fran, and hosting Seattle. They should not be favored in any of these games, although San Francisco is reeling due to their injuries, but may potentially have their top QB and TE back by the time they play WFT. The last two games of the season involve Carolina and Philly - arguably, WFT will be underdogs for both of these games, but it depends on what direction Carolina and Philly take in terms of personnel and who they decide to play.
Overall, this Dallas game on Thursday is a huge swing game for the WFT. If they can win, 5 wins is somewhat feasible. If not, it looks very daunting. I'm bumping up my forecast based on their win against Cincy, but not by a lot.

A win! A win! Washington beat the Bungles, so they have 3 wins. That means they need only two more. Unbelievably, they're tied for second in their division at 3-7. I still feel good about that game. So that puts them at 4 wins. That means they need one more...they have the Cowboys on Thanksgiving! A huge game and a huge tradition. I don't feel as good as I felt about that game earlier in the month. The Cowboys have Andy Dalton back and they just beat the Vikings. Plus, they have the best winning percentage on Thanksgiving among teams with 10 or more games and they're 8-1(!) against Washington on Thanksgiving (https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/11/23/washington-football-nfc-east-three-wins/). Washington is 3-8 on Thanksgiving overall AND the Cowboys are getting three points from Vegas on Thursday. SO! I'm not feeling as good. Be that as it may, I gave them a 25% shot when they needed three more wins, and they have one of the three I thought they'd get. I don't feel as good about the Dallas game, but I still feel okaaaay, and the more I see of Philly, the more I think they've got a chance to win against Philly at the end of the season. The way I see it, that game might mean tanking for a high pick or (incredibly) winning for a chance to get into the playoffs. So of the games they have left, I feel good about beating the Panthers, and I think they have an ok shot to beat either the Cowboys or the Eagles.  So I'm going to ooch up my projection ever-so-slightly. I'm gonna move them up to 50% for now and see how things go. They just need two more!

And then I'll round down a bit more because of COVID and the outside chance they don't complete all three games they need to win (and they could also tie). The Washington Football team currently sits at 2-6 with 8 games to play. Of those games, only 4 are against teams have similar or worse records. Two of the remaining eight opponents are currently leading their divisions with significantly better records. Due to this alone, it is highly unlikely that Washington exceeds four games. Compounding Washington's challenges is its most recent loss against a struggling Giants handing the team its second victory on the year.

Baserate: The WFT has won 2 games so far. In the modern (16 game) NFL, 142 teams have started out 2 and 6. Of those teams, 86 have gone on to win 5 or more games. This suggests about a 60% chance that the WFT will win 5 or more games.  More inside odds: 538 says their average season is 5-11 [1], which suggests that have around a 50% chance of winning 5 or more games. Of their remaining eight games, they have two or three tough matchups (Seahawks, Steelers, 49ers), but five very winnable games (Lions, Bengals, Cowboys, Panthers, and Eagles).  Overall, I think any prediction between 40-70% is reasonable. I think I'll go with 55%, right in between the 538 rate and the long term base rate.  [1] https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-nfl-predictions/
